title: Macron is not going to bail out Boris. The PM will have to save Brexit from the Remainers himself
text:
Despite persuading MPs to support his Brexit deal in principle last night, Boris Johnson's failure to see his fast timetable approved proved so awkward that he decided not to push on with his legislation while he rang around his European counterparts to remind them how much he hated the idea of further delay.

EU leaders have been mulling the request from the UK Government, forced by Hilary Benn's so-called "Surrender Act", to push back the deadline to 31 January 2020. Donald Tusk has understandably concluded from Mr Johnson's parked Brexit bill that Westminster is in no state to ratify the deal anytime soon. And so the European Council leader has suggested that the EU27 needs to get on and agree...
description: Despite persuading MPs to support his Brexit deal in principle last night, Boris Johnson's failure to see his fast timetable approved proved so awkward that he decided not to push on with his legislation while he rang around his European counterparts to remind them how much he hated the idea of further delay.
